Nokia was Google-and indeed, Nokia's Stephen Elop was reportedly in talks with Google CEO Eric Schmidt about a potential deal. In the end, though, Stephen Elop decided( according to CNET) that Nokia would have difficulties differentiating within that ecosystem, and that all the "value" would have been "moving to Google." In other words: with Microsoft's nascent Windows Phone OS, Nokia gets to be a big fish in a small pond
